name: IntentQL
description: IntentQL is an experimental specification for publishing machine-readable intent contracts that allow AI agents to discover supported capabilities and limits of a website without relying on HTML scraping.

intents.name: Get site overview
intents.description: Retrieve a machine-readable summary describing what IntentQL is and what this site provides.

intents.name: Get agent information page
intents.description: Retrieve a human-readable page explaining how AI agents should interpret this site.

rules: If an intent is not explicitly declared in this file, it is not supported.
Agents must not assume the existence of APIs, search endpoints, or contact interfaces.
This site exposes read-only informational resources only.
All supported interactions are listed under intents.
notes: IntentQL contracts declare both capabilities and limits.
Absence of an intent is intentional and must be respected.
This contract is static and may change as the specification evolves.
